programme.title: We need to talk about Cosby S1 (1/4)
programme.desc: A look at how, in the 1960s, Bill Cosby allegedly began exploiting his power.

programme.title: Mission déco S4 (1/8)
programme.desc: Ten budding interior designers transform apartments in London's Elephant and Castle.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S26 (11/30)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Kent, Yorkshire and Greater Manchester.

programme.title: The Bidding Room S4 (13/30)
programme.desc: Dealers bid to buy a rice warmer, a vase, a hop sieve, a port pourer and a harmonium.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows us how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man whose beachfront plots are at the constant mercy of the sea. Arit Anderson meets a woman on a mission to "green up" neglected urban spaces. Kate Bradbury shares her tips for attracting wildlife into our gardens, and Toby Buckland helps Sue Kent tackle some tricky jobs in the garden. There's also a tech-savvy grower in Bristol who loves to experiment on his allotment, and a gardener in Manchester who grows an interest array of plants on his 18th-floor balcony. Plus another look at viewers' films from their own gardens.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: Le roi des rois
programme.desc: Colourful dramatisation of the birth, life and death of Jesus Christ.

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A retrospective look at television appearances made over the years by the legendary Hollywood actor and director Orson Welles, capturing the milestones and highlights of his life and career. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.

programme.title: Jill Halfpenny's Easter Journeys S1 (1/2)
programme.desc: Actress Jill Halfpenny travels across the North East on a journey of discovery at Easter.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain (Glasgow) (n°9)
programme.desc: «Glasgow»Si and Dave explore Glasgow's shipbuilding history.

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge (Final) S2 (6/6)
programme.desc: «Final»The four artists tackle self-portraits before an ultimate final challenge.

programme.title: My Unique B&B (Nigel and Maria's Caravan) S2 (10/15)
programme.desc: «Nigel and Maria's Caravan»Simon and team head to Devon to help turn a unique 1970s caravan into a modern B&B.

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect S2
programme.desc: Dennis and Christine had always dreamed of living by the sea in a place big enough to host their large family. A former B&B in Margate with six bedrooms seemed the answer to their prayers but, seven years later, they are still at a loss as to how to turn the rambling property into a comfortable family home. The couple reluctantly hand the reins to architects Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison.

programme.title: Flog It ! S16
programme.desc: Paul Martin visits the Watts Gallery in the heart of the Surrey countryside, where experts David Harper and Thomas Plant are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. David uncovers a collection of British film and TV memorabilia and Thomas is thrilled by some French cameo glass. Paul Martin is on the trail of Martians in Woking, the setting for HG Wells's sci-fi novel The War of the Worlds.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games S5
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Kemah Bob, JJ Chalmers, Kevin Clifton and Victoria Derbyshire take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday. Will the winning stars opt for the much-coveted House of Games decanter, or will they be tempted by the House of Games kitchen composter?

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival (Cardiff) S1 (20/20)
programme.desc: «Cardiff»Sean Fletcher discovers food tips and treats as he explores Cardiff Market.

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands S1 (1/4)
programme.desc: Iolo Williams discovers shrill carder bees, fallow deer and nightjars in Monmouthshire.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Beechgrove Garden is back and ready to guide you through a season of great growing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty adds some interest to the spring garden. He also sows peas and shallots, has some thrifty tips for petunias, and plants lilies in pots. Carol Klein visits Mothecombe Gardens in Devon, which has been designed specifically for pollinators, with swathes of nectar-rich daisies and lavender. Arit Anderson joins a group of young carers at a community garden in West Sussex, where they go for respite, friendship and fun. Plus more of the films that have been sent in by viewers.

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road to Santiago S5 (1/3)
programme.desc: Seven well-known personalities meet in Portugal to tackle a modern Catholic pilgrimage.

programme.title: Les recettes du bonheur
programme.desc: The Kadam family madden Madame Mallory by opening a restaurant opposite hers.

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Another selection of football, music and lifestyle from around the Premier League scene.
